intro: Pedicularis abrotanifolia, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive hooded shape, typical of the genus Pedicularis. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
